Probably cause when you watch a yuri show or read yuri work, the girl x girl romance is right in your face and the whole point of the show becomes the romantic aspect of the love story between the girls. Gundam isn't heavy on romance but because the main pair duo are both girls it's pretty gay. They're having a natural subtle progression mostly not to scare away viewership that might be turned off about anything yuri related but instead to ease them towards the idea that the only option for these girls are each other. I tend to prefer my action shows with yuri in it rather than watching a one plot romance story most of the time.

The terminology I use, personally, is there are yuri shows, and shows with yuri in it. G-Witch is what I would consider the latter.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>3840371
It's like PriPri, yeah? The relationship between Princess and Ange is very important, and it's very gay, but the story itself isn't primarily about their relationship, it's about spy things.

I think sometimes people think of yuri as essentially a subcategory of romance, i.e. the romantic relationship has to be front and center, and so anything where romance is just a subplot falls out of that category.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>3840371
>G-Witch is not a Yuri show, it just so happens that the main protagonist duo's relationship is a central focus of the show and it simply happens to be gay.
>When I read it, why the heck does it make sense to me?
Because SuleMio's romance and growing relationship is not the singular, main focus of the show - we don't see them engaging in the usual tropes of school romance works such as going on dates, sharing food, and the only time (iirc?) we really saw them in class together was when it was plot-relevant for the piloting exam.
The duels, ongoing school and corporate politics are given a fair bit of importance and screen time, and we mainly see Suletta and Miorine grow as characters and as a couple through /those/ plots rather than any usual romance character path.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
The Red Scholar's Wake by some french bitch idk

Felt weirdly pretentious in its prose and the way it keeps referring to words in english as though they're only rough translations of words in chinese or vietnamese or whatever (not specified), and uses lots of shorthand for words that apparently have more complicated meanings. Assumed it was some prissy new age college asian girl from berkely or oregon or whatever, but after finishing it and realizing it was written by a french chick also makes a ton of sense. Honestly, props to her for doing the research into the asian culture and aesthetic well enough to make me think otherwise.

Anyways, story's pretty good, kinda simple. It's a lesbian romance space opera. Lots of shit going down with space pirates and politics, but the main character is sheltered from it for the first 2/3 of the book and instead is preoccupied with personal issues. The climax is well-played, with a sex scene that feels very neatly wrapped up until things go to hell because of a miscommunication, and set in motion the home stretch.

If you're not into any of: extremely asian aesthetic and vibes, women that are space ships, sex with space ships, it's probably a no-go, but the romance is integral to the plot and it's ultimately well-rewarded. Sort of similar character setup and execution to Baru, but significantly less harrowing and tragic.

>>3838727
>I get discouraged due to license issues
Not that anon, but here you go:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1dEbxtBlvwxj2ZwtcoNU05Cg4_pgpuBYAWbO_5twoA2A/edit#gid=0
No matter what the spreadsheet states, always check the license information on a website before you start picking music, some like to add their silly conditions and such, like "you can use this for videos but you have to pay me to use it in games!".
Here's some explanation on common licenses you may have already read:
https://opengameart.org/content/faq
And since it's a common misconception, there's no license that forces you to share the source code of a game just because you included an asset in it, some licenses compel you to share a 'source' version of an asset if you modified it from its original version, but only on request.
Merry listening.

I finished it. Probably a bit too many male sex scenes/ hand job scenes for anyone that wants a Full Yuri NTR game (Girl getting NTR'd by another Girl.) But you can probably just skip most of those and not really miss out on anything. The overall story was pretty good and I'd definitely recommend if you like NTR/Yuri.

Besides that, I only have 2 real complaints. (Spoilers, obviously.) The 1st being that all of the adults are already corrupted by the Mother when the story starts. The FMC, Mitomo, is the only girl we see the progression of falling into being a lesbian. The other childhood friend, Rena, is shown being seduced for 1 scene, but then it cuts away before you see her having sex with the Mother. The next time you see her, she's a pet to the Mother.

The 2nd complaint is that after both Mitomo and Rena admit to being lesbians, they talk about seducing other girls on their own. Rena admits to seducing and having sex her Kouhai, and Mitomo says she's been eyeing a girl and wants to seduce her. Both are never actually shown, just talked about. Probably just a CG budget constraint, I know CG's cost a lot of money, but it would've been nice to see those scenes as well.
